channel.title: Messy Saved game file
channel.description:
hey guys, i've downloaded a source and i want to make my self owner but everything is just messy!
here is a picture how it looks like : http://gyazo.com/7d0bd125133613ebd978f1d668ba8a63
how can i make it nice, so you see like this:
Username: Beats Password: Soldier123 Rights: 3
cuz thats how i wanna have it like=/ can someone help me
My skype is : negash.tat : i've teamviewer 6/7 I'm using 614 source RuneDesign
i hope you can help me :$

item.title: Messy Saved game file
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“tomato721, post:12, topic:448499”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=551397.msg4040673#msg4040673 date=1341602975]

en.wikipedia.org

Serialization

In computer science, in the context of data storage, serialization is the process of translating data structures or object state into a format that can be stored (for example, in a file or memory buffer) or transmitted (for example, across a network connection link) and reconstructed later (possibly in a different computer environment). When the resulting series of bits is reread according to the serialization format, it can be used to create a semantically identical clone of the original obje Th...

And considering how easy it is to do in Java, most people fall back on it to use for save files
[/quote]
they should just use .txt format its much easier :L[/quote]

No where near as efficient. It is easier for the operator to edit however

Read full topic

item.title: Messy Saved game file
item.dc:creator: @beats beats
item.description:
@beats wrote:

[quote=“99rangek0, post:8, topic:448499”]I’ll try and help you change your rights and make yourself owner.

I’ve got a 639, but I’m pretty sure it’s really similar to yours. Look and see if you have a file named “Actionsender.java”
If so use ctrl+f and search for
player.getDefinition().setRights(2);

It may be worded different due to revision difference, so you could just search the word “Rights” until you found it.
Once there you’ll see something similar to
if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(“YOURNAMEHERE”))
player.getDefinition().setRights(2);

Put your name in the YOURNAMEHERE section.
And there ya go - Your an admin (Theres no owner ranks in the higher end revisions by default unless you code the thing yourself)[/quote] i dont have action sender

Read full topic

item.title: Messy Saved game file
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Serialization

In computer science, in the context of data storage, serialization is the process of translating data structures or object state into a format that can be stored (for example, in a file or memory buffer) or transmitted (for example, across a network connection link) and reconstructed later (possibly in a different computer environment). When the resulting series of bits is reread according to the serialization format, it can be used to create a semantically identical clone of the original obje Th...

And considering how easy it is to do in Java, most people fall back on it to use for save files

Read full topic

item.title: Messy Saved game file
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

HcoJustin:

Its not “encrypted” its just a bunch of serialized objects. You’ll need to use a hex editor to change your rights, or redo the way files are saved

Whats the point of ‘serialized objects’?

Read full topic

item.title: Messy Saved game file
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

I’ll try and help you change your rights and make yourself owner.

I’ve got a 639, but I’m pretty sure it’s really similar to yours. Look and see if you have a file named “Actionsender.java”
If so use ctrl+f and search for
player.getDefinition().setRights(2);

It may be worded different due to revision difference, so you could just search the word “Rights” until you found it.
Once there you’ll see something similar to
if (player.getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase(“YOURNAMEHERE”))
player.getDefinition().setRights(2);

Put your name in the YOURNAMEHERE section.
And there ya go - Your an admin (Theres no owner ranks in the higher end revisions by default unless you code the thing yourself)

Read full topic
